body: This is likely do the major refactor/rewrite of the warnings system that occurred in 3.8.0 -- I wonder if this bit slipped under the radar CC @nicoddemus
Seems like it, thanks @CAM-Gerlach. I'll look into it. üëç
Thanks @asottile and @nicoddemus ! I figured it had to be something related to that big overhaul.

issue.title: Show node that originated a warning in the warnings summary

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Weird that nobody has reported this regression until now (and embarrassing that I did not notice this myself earlier!)

Here's how it looks on `master`:

```
========================= warnings summary ==========================
c:\pytest\.tmp\test-warning-loc.py:5: UserWarning: This is a test warning
  warnings.warn("This is a test warning")
```

And with this PR:

```
========================= warnings summary ==========================
test-warning-loc.py::test_foo
  c:\pytest\.tmp\test-warning-loc.py:5: UserWarning: This is a test warning
    warnings.warn("This is a test warning")
```

Fix #4221

issue.title: RemovedInPytest4Warning via _pytest\compat.py:321

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: easy issue that is friendly to new contributor

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
There are many RemovedInPytest4Warnings with pytest's own tests, e.g.:

```
c:\projects\pytest\.tox\py36\lib\site-packages\_pytest\compat.py:321: RemovedInPytest4Warning: usage of Session.Class is deprecated, please use pytest.Class instead
360  return getattr(object, name, default)
361
```

(via https://ci.appveyor.com/project/pytestbot/pytest/builds/19474342/job/c83h5n8ne3snvf8o#L359)

Are those expected?

I would assume pytest should not causes warnings itself.
